description:
Needed a place near by to eat since we were sooo hungry and didn't wanna settle for "mall food" after shopping. I yelped this place and I had to try this considering it has a solid 4 stars and over 500 reviews. Got seated after 10 min which wasn't bad at all. Place closes at 10pm on a Friday, we arrived around 9:15pm. It's very kid-friendly, with nice tables and pictures against the wall. Anyways about the food, the wait time was sort of long to me. That's my *only* complaint about this place but it's well-worth it once u dive into your sushi. 

I ordered a winter wonderland, and a caterpillar roll. Both were reasonable portion sizes-not teeny tiny sushi rolls. It was reaaaaaaaaally good! Flavorful, and filling! I wanted to order more but after ordering those, I was already stuffed. It wasn't bad at all paying only $27 with seaweed salad on the side which is what I always have to have when I eat sushi. If you need a place and you're around the sunset district, this is it.
author: Jade D.

description:
RIDICULOUS !!! I ordered chirashi bowl, it came with 6pc of fish but all of them was frozen!! The waitress said we have fresh one and frozen one, FUCKING FUNNY!!!
She asked 'We have a fresh one do you want it?' What do you guys think?? I cancelled it but
She didn't even say sorry or responded anything.
Non professional at all.
author: Pajaree S.

description:
Really loved my trip here! The sushi is absolutely DELICIOUS and so fresh. Probably the best Philly roll I've ever had, and everything that came to our table looked great. Although we were seated immediately, it took a while to get our order taken, and subsequently it took some time to get water refills and the such. But it wouldn't stop me from coming here again (and again, and again... and again). 

If you're looking for a place that won't break the bank, but will give you a delicious experience in a cozy, homey environment: look no further. Enjoy!
author: Will K.

description:
With all the sushi spots in SF, you have to wonder how to choose a place. Sushi Zen is good, cheap, and somewhat quick. Put on some glasses though cause you will probably walk past this place. The entrance is literally one door and squeezed between two larger restaurants. The interior is more old-fashioned which is quite cute and there's hardly a line.

In terms of authenticity, it's probably not going to be the most authentic sushi but the fish is fresh and the rolls are quite good. Tsunami and sunset rolls were quite good and their bento boxes aren't too bad. For what you pay, you can get a pretty substantial meal. So all in all, Sushi Zen is actually a pretty underrated restaurant but that may also be cause it's so low key.
author: Derek T.

description: The place looks a little bit sus from the outside but once you come into the restaurant it's such a warm environment & the sushi is sooo bomb. All the waitresses are super sweet women
author: Maggie A.

description:
I was visiting a friend of mines in Daly City, we were both craving for sushi. So we ended up stopping by at this place here in the city! 

ENVIRONMENT - 3/5 Rate
Yes, you are here in San Francisco. Although this part of the area, parking was not as excruciating. Just give a little patience and you will find a metered parking on the streets. Judging on the outside of this restaurant, you could tell that this place is a typical hole in the wall. The inside was very casual. Nothing that sparked my eye. I love how they put pictures of customers eating their food on the wall. Shows the community spirits! Staffs were really friendly and welcoming as soon as we walk in. I love the traditional way where whenever customers walk, they would aggressively greet you in Japanese!

BENTO BOX - 7.5/10 Rate
At any sushi restaurant, it is mandatory for me to order the bento boxes. I am a big eater and could easily demolish the entire box. This particular bento I've ordered came with Sashimi, Chicken Katsu, California Rolls, salad, and rice. The Sashimis were fresh. Definitely love the raw fish with wasabi. The Chicken Katsu was slightly soggy but didn't bother me to an extent. Everything was very nicely presented in this bento. The bento box was a good size portion, although could be bigger.

CONCLUSION 
In conclusion, you got yourself a decent Japanese restaurant in town. I would adequalely say that this is an average sushi restuarant, there wasn't anything that stood out. Nothing exotic or impressive. The staffs were friendly and provided great services.  I would recommend this restaurant to Yelpers. I would come back here and eat again!
author: Alan L.

description: It is a small sushi place...bit outdated interior but sushi was good n mostly fresh. They have lunch combos are very reasonable price. We got shrimp tempura and super dynamite roll. It was good but a bit salty.  Comes with miso soup. We also got tuna makki which ok. Street parking is easy to find. They have special pricing for students would recommend. Worth trying for the price point.
author: Nidhi D.

description: Was on Taraval and decided to try a new sushi spot I had never heard of or been to. It looked really cozy inside and a true urban city spot. I had the chicken teriyaki and California roll. My friend got tempura and caterpillar roll. It was all decent and good. Maybe not stellar, that's why I didn't give it five stars, but good enough altogether. If you around this part of the Sunset, it's fine to eat some good old Japanese food at. Service is good.
author: Denise C.

description:
Oooh good sashmi bento boxes for a reasonable price! 

My friend and fellow Yelper brought my attention to this place on Taraval, a block or two from 19th. Literally almost missed it walking up from my car! Parking over here can be a pain if you're looking for street parking off Taraval, but expensive SF meter parking is ok if you're willing to drop a few bucks.

I was really impressed that for about $12, you could get an assorted sashimi bento that included miso soup, california rolls, salad, and the sashimi. The fish was all fresh and a pretty nice portion too! 

Would definitely come back if I was craving sashimi and bento items! Their special rolls seem pretty good too so I would be down to try them next time.
author: Clarissa C.

description:
Great sushi place in sunset. Their salmon was fatty and good. We came Friday night around 6 and we found a table without waiting.
I ordered British Columbia and my bf ordered Chirashi don. Again, the salmon was super fatty and good. Sashimi on the chirashi was fresh and good.
I wanna try real sushi I mean not californian to enjoy the fish. I will come here again.
author: Nazuki Y.

description: This is not a bad place for good sushi, guys!!! I ordered the Alaska roll with a sake sashimi sampler for dinner. The fish tasted pretty damn fresh, and my meal ended up totaling less than $15! The inside is very quaint. Not too much seating, but there wasn't too many people when I came in with my family. So it was a very comfortable seating experience. Additionally, we received a lot of hospitality from the Chinese waitresses and sushi chef. I highly recommend this place if you're looking for good-quality and affordable sushi. As a bonus, their menu also features a lot of cooked options (e.g. dinner sets with rice and soup, noodles), so there's definitely something for everyone.
author: Connie X.

description:
The first time we went to this place, I got the winter wonderland. It was very tiny and not as amazing as I thought it would be. Maybe that was just a one time fluke.

So the second time we went, we got British Columbia, sunset strip, sweet shrimp nigiri, sashimi combo, salmon teriyaki meal, and fried oysters. They were all super yummy. The sunset strip was spicy. The sweet shrimp was amazing. It came with fried shrimp heads which were meh. The fried oysters were also super yummy. But the salmon teriyaki was meh. It was not tender or juicy enough.
author: Amanda L.

description: Shush zen is pretty under rated, I got no bad meals. I would come when it just opens because it's not crowded. Service is excellent and so is the food. But is pretty bad, it's kind of hard you probably have to walk a lot.
author: Conner C.

description: Friendly staff, delicious food and great price what else could I ask for?! Best sushi spot on the area, i would suggest try their salmon bento boxes and California rolls
author: Luiz S.

description: One of the best all you can eat sushi places I've been too! Reasonable rice I'd given with each piece of sushi. Great atmosphere and service:) would gladly return here, recommend the Eel Nigiri :)
author: Jung J.

description: The food was excellent.  The service was so outrageously terrible, every aspect of our order was incorrect.  When we politely corrected or requested items be removed from our order after not received, we were treated as though we were wrong.  Such an unpleasant meal.  But the food was really good.
author: Tracy L.

description: Amazing sushi, great prices, and such friendly service. My go -to sushi place in Sunset.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Saturday afternoon.  Hungry for sushi, so we checked this place out.
Came in and were seated and given a menu by a lady who was sitting at the sushi bar when we arrived.  No words, just gave us the menu and left.  We looked it over, it is very limited.  Nobody came by.  We're out.  Not enough here to want us to order and nobody acting like they wanted our business.
author: Joe T.

description:
Great! All the wonderful pictures of the rolls  made me want to go in and try it tonight (to go). But I ended up getting the chicken teriyaki dinner (includes miso soup & a little salad) with a Hawaii roll... it's been abnormally cold in the city and feeling under the weather made me want to get something warmer :) 
Really good chicken teriyaki; clean cuts of chicken and nice teriyaki sauce.
author: Tere C.

description: The Winter Wonderland roll is my absolute favorite! Great priced sushi with large portions and easily accessible by Muni. I think upgrading the interior of the restaurant would be a great update to the business; but I come for the food, not the decor :)
author: Marissa R.

description:
I'll start by saying that the service is really great. We were seated quickly, given time to order, our food came out pretty quickly, and they gave us ice cream on the house after our meal.

I really wanted to love this place and thought I would given the rave reviews here on Yelp. We ordered a few rolls - some with the sauces/cooked fish and some with raw fish and no sauces. The rolls range in price from $8-14, if I remember correctly. The rolls came out in the order they were made, rather than all together, which was fine with me. They were average in size and had a good amount of fish. There wasn't really anything wrong with them, but they lacked a "wow" factor and didn't include what they said was included on the menu (one of our rolls was supposed to come with spicy tuna on the inside, but instead, there was shrimp tempura....). I thought each roll was either too salty or too sweet. We also had the miso soup, which was really salty and smelled funny to me (tasted like instant soup).

Anyway, I didn't love the fish (salty, fresh?) or the rolls. Even though it's cheap, I probably won't be back. :(
author: Nelya T.

description:
My home away from home! The wonderful owner & staff always greets you with a smile. They treat everyone as an honored guest, including your choice of ice cream to sweeten the end of your meal! Healthy fresh sushi with a smile and a fair value, hard to beat! 
Chefs choice Sashimi 10 piece is awesome!! Ikura nigiri is also my fav!
Sunomono (Japanese Cucumber Salad) refreshing & crisp, very delicious! (I always get the Ebi (shrimp) Sunomono)
author: Laurie C.

description:
Came back a second time and still really liked it!

Got the Poke and it's my new favorite!

Still very reasonably priced.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Food tasted good , I liked their fish especially their poki bowl but unfortunately right after eating their food me and my GF  we got really bad diarrhea
Would never come back
author: Bryan D.

description: Solid cheap neighborhood sushi. Usually not hard to get a table or find parking nearby. Would be unfair to compare to expensive places.
author: Karl K.

description:
My boyfriend and I have been coming to this place for two years, but today's experience was terrible. Not a simple hello or anything when we sat down at our table. Our server didn't ask us what we would like to drink, but came to place waters on our table, made no eye contact, and then left. We weren't able to place our order until we had to flag her down again to talk to her. The wait for our food wasn't long, unfortunately, our sushi was slightly warm when it came to our table which gave me an unsettling feeling. Our portions were somewhat small as well. As we ate our food, our server didn't come once to the table to ask if we needed anything. Pretty much providing no service. 

To top it all off, after paying for the bill, we left our tip on the table. As we were putting on our coats to leave, our server shoves me aside to get to our table, swipes the tip and hurries to clean up. I made the effort to look around to see if we needed to rush, however, there was no line and plenty of seats open. No thank you was said or please come again, instead I said sorry for being in her way and also said thank you to her for her service. Within in that short interaction, she never addressed me once. 

I usually don't write a lot of reviews, but this one in particular really bothered me. We were probably in the restaurant for a total of 30 minutes, it felt very unwelcoming.
author: Natalie L.

description:
You want sushi? You'll get sushi! 

I've been here twice. Both times left an impression on me. The first time was roughly a year ago, I came with a friend for my sushi cravings. If I remember correctly, it was during lunch time. There wasn't a long wait and the service was pretty good. I'm not a roll person,  if you want a review on rolls please check out fellow yelpers that have reviewed this place. I'm focused on nigiri and hand rolls. First off, I can't get sushi just anywhere. I came here the first time to just satisfy my tummy. It was pretty average. But what got me was the sashimi, it wasn't fishy or slimy. The only con is I wish the rice and fish were more room temperature and if they put wasabi between their fish and rice.

Fast forward a year. I am celebrating a special occasion with my boyfriend. It was a Sunday night and literally was the most reasonable sushi place near SFSU. Nigiri at this place goes from 3 to 9 depending on what you get. I ordered everything I personally get at my sushi restaurant back home. My boyfriend doesn't really ever order nigiri so it was his first experience and he loved it, especially the uni! The fish didn't taste frozen. There was no pink or redish color on my rice, usually that's because the fish slice was frozen. It basically melted in your mouth. 

If you want to go to get decent nigiri for a reasonable price go here. The only con was that the second time the food took an extremely long time, people even left. There were people waitinf before us that didnt get seated however, they didnt seem to realize you need to go to the front if they are busy. Just give this place a fair shot.
author: Ann N.

description: This place makes great bento boxes and the value is great!  We usually get the chicken and/or salmon teriyaki and they do it really well here.  The sushi isn't bad either and they have a good variety of rolls to choose from.  We get take out here once a month!
author: Al Y.

description: This place makes generic sushi - like a better version of grocery store sushi. It's uninspired and mediocre. Their sushi is cheaper than other places so you still get value. It will do if you don't have many options.
author: Theresa N.

description: This is one of those head-scratching restaurant where the reviews are much better than the quality of the sushi. This place was kind of a dumb the food quality was okay but no rear mirror a level that justify the prices of the food. There seems to be a lot of these bizarre highly rated restaurants.
author: Eric A.

description: I've been craving sushi for the past week or so; I was pleased to find Sushi Zen while running errands.  I order the chirashi, philly roll and amaebi nigiri for pick up. The people were friendly, the service was quick and prices were on the lower end. The place was about 65% full and the Japanese decor was cute. I didn't have to travel far before I was able to chow down. The raw sushi was room temp, but I thought it tasted fresh enough for the price and the flavors meshed well.  Unfortunately, I also received a bonus cleanse that wasn't part of my order.  Given that I did eat a huge order, perhaps it was my body telling me that I shouldn't have. Either way, I didn't appreciate being forced to exercise, sprinting to the restroom for the next couple of hours.
author: J T.

description:
This is a decent spot for sushi if you live in the area. I've eaten here a few times both at the restaurant and take out. All of their rolls are pretty good, my favorite is the lazy summer roll. The mango that's included in the roll plus the cucumber wrap make the roll so light and refreshing. The price is fairly reasonable at about $11-12 per roll. 
Service has always been attentive and courteous. And if you're ordering for take out, it's usually ready in about ten minutes.
author: Gloria N.

description: One of the best sushi places in the city. Hard to believe since it's a whole in a wall. But the best things are the mysterious ones sometimes. So thanks to the whole team that make the food and serve it. We look forward to each of our visit there.
author: Hanae H.

description:
I was pretty impressed with this place. Came here for dinner and ordered some Miso Soup, the yellow tail roll and a Lazy Summer roll. The prices are fairly reasonable. Soup was $1.50, yellowtail was $4.00 and the Lazy Summer roll was $13.

The service was excellent. The food came out fast and tasted really yummy. On top of all of this the server came out and offered me free ice cream at the end of my meal - on the house!!

Will definitely be coming back!
author: James D.

description:
I came here for lunch and ordered Set # E( tempura and Super Dynamite roll), Amaebi and Uni negiri. 

The rolls were big, because it was filled mostly with rice , imitation crab and globs of sauce. There was very little spicy tuna and tempura shrimp . Such a scam . 

Uni and Amaebi were not so fresh, but still edible.  Amaebi heads were dipped in a thick flour batter , deep fried and totally over cooked. Tasted like rubber . 

Two Stars for the attentive wait staff and friendly chef.  

I don't know how they lasted this long. 

My 2nd visit and definitely my last
author: Joe L.

description:
I came here with 2 friends specifically looking for Hamachi Kama. We came here for lunch and ordered a hamachi kama to share and their lunch sets. 

One friend ordered the squid natto special. This one's really good! but only if you know you're a fan of natto

The lunch sets contained a small piece of saba shioyaki, a small scoup of rice,4 pieces of california roll (with no avocado) and a salad with dressing. $10.50 I would probably not get this again. 

The hamachi kama was also $10.50 which is low compared to other alternatives in SF, but the piece was also much smaller. 

overall, an A-OK experience. I probably wouldn't go out of my way and come here again especially since the drive is quite far for me.
author: Annie Z.

description:
It is simple for what it is, bento box is alright and for the price it is good, thou sometimes I don't always get fill up compare to sushi raw. Great place to go to for lunch time, cheap price for student, and they get a lot for the price.
Overall it is ok
author: Calvin T.

description:
it's the worst Japanese beef rice I ever have in my life. The beef was so dry and hard. Not a real Japanese style at all. 
My friend had the fried chicken which seems was fried three hours ago
author: Roy M.

description:
Hard to rate this place, because the fish is fresh and the flavor is there, but the ART is not. 

I've worked with sushi before in a restaurant I ran and it's not very easy to roll a sushi roll! But these sushi chefs should be able to do it eyes closed with a dull knife considering the thousands of times they have done it before. 

But the whole point of a sushi roll is that it's able to be picked up by chopsticks and put into your mouth easily. I'm super skilled with the sticks so I was able to scoop it up and pile the ingredients on top of itself as it fell apart but it's not as enjoyable of a dining experience so I'm deducting star rating because that's a big part of sushi.
author: Jessica M.

description:
Sushi Zen is more of a 2.5star for me just based on the food, but service was incredibly friendly and prices are pretty reasonable, especially for the amaebi, so upbump it is. 

The restaurant itself is owned by Chinese owners, and servers can all speak Chinese as far as I could tell. Service was bustling and very motherly (my guess is due to the area), but tea refills came quite frequently and recommendations were enthusiastic. We wouldn't have ordered the saba shioyaki if not for the recommendation of the waitress that it was her frequent dinner on the menu, and it turned out to be a favorite.

Miso soup:
(http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=SreqPSrNxaO7KVRUuPzYKg&userid=1ug7EtH4blOzzbqqkmkenA)
Mediocre at best, the miso soup here had a slightly bitter aftertaste. It's a personal preference, as I know some friends who actually prefer that aftertaste, but I like my miso soup a tad lighter. 

Sashimi side order:
(http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=BxLkVI2sx1s3LowYp1E0qw&userid=1ug7EtH4blOzzbqqkmkenA)
The caliber of sashimi here is very mediocre. I understand that it was a side order, but the pieces were rather thin with little texture. The salmon was slightly dry and the tuna a bit mealy, but the super white tuna was decent. Wasabi obviously came from a tube, and the ginger veered on the sweet side. 

Amaebi:
(http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=H22z8Z07Koov5vSDn71BIw&userid=1ug7EtH4blOzzbqqkmkenA)
Fried amaebi heads:
(http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=aSXvGju4jmCOGAP0EE4fZg&userid=1ug7EtH4blOzzbqqkmkenA)
The amaebi nigiri here was some ridiculous price (I think maybe $3.99?), which was the least expensive I've ever seen it being offered. I was a little skeptical to order it at first, as you usually get what you pay for, but the nigiri was surprisingly good. It was fresh and had really nice texture, down to the tobiko on top. The fried heads were a bit overbreaded, but came out piping hot and were obviously freshly fried. For that price and surprising caliber, I had to order a second round.

Saba shioyaki:
(http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=A4n4uuiQhVQJNKRipv_hUw&userid=1ug7EtH4blOzzbqqkmkenA)
The unexpected star of the night, this saba shioyaki was probably one of the best grilled pieces of fish I'd ever had. It was so incredibly succulent and moist and well-marinated that I almost - almost! - ordered a second, but I was pretty full after our roll came that I didn't. It was the perfect balance of salty and smoky, and I was definitely impressed with the waitress's recommendation. The salad was unmemorable, and I didn't use the sauce because the fish really didn't need it so can't comment on it. 

Super white tuna roll:
(http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=DE2eBlr7u8jFXtZTOk1-dg&userid=1ug7EtH4blOzzbqqkmkenA)
I probably wouldn't order rolls here again, but I thought I'd give this one a try. The super white tuna was interestingly pink, but it didn't have bad texture. The sushi rice was subpar though, and the roll pretty much fell apart at the touch of a chopstick. I did appreciate that the roll itself wasn't drenched in sauce, but it left much to be desired and wasn't worth the asking price.

I may not return to Sushi Zen unless I were in the area and didn't want to venture farther, but it yielded a decent dinner during my visit.
author: Maggie X.

description:
We were in the mood for sushi but wanted to venture a little outside of our usual place - K's Kitchen. Being a Friday night, the high rated places off Irving/Mission neighborhoods weren't in the plan. We settled for Sushi Zen.
The photos on the Yelp page looked promising, but looks can be deceiving as we soon found out. I don't want to come off as a sushi snob, but well, maybe I do. We ordered our usual basics (well, tried to) hamachi, tuna..(nope, looked frozen), salmon..(nope not having farmed), uh had to fill in with whatever else possibly would suffice. Rounded up with escolar (partially frozen), tai (bad cut, super chewy that they had to cut slits in the fish so you can eat it), and scallop (best of all tonight). Time to fill in a roll as well so we won't leave hungry - Sunset Strip roll (pretty good roll with hamachi, mango and unagi inside with tuna and salmon with house sauce outside).
I saw another couple eating Japanese dinner entrees at the sushi bar, which isn't a good sign as normally the sushi bar is more for patrons wanting sushi. The tempura dinner looked good, so what the heck, I'll have one too. I must say, this was the highlight of dinner. 3 pieces of shrimp with a variety of vegetables, a bowl of rice and miso soup for $10.99. What a deal!
So on a scale of 1 to 10, I'd rate the sushi quality as a 4. There were irregular shaped cuts, partially frozen cuts and well, cuts that shouldn't even be served on sushi. However, the prices here at Sushi Zen won't break the bank. You get what you pay for.
Before I forget, the service is to be desired. How would you like the waitress squeezing herself against you to put in the order and pick up at least 10 times during your meal, waiting 10 minutes to get more tea or best of all (drum roll please...), the sushi chef asking you if everything IS ok when you are about to leave. I mean why ask? The point of asking is so you can make adjustments so your customer feels welcomed and valued. We are leaving and THEN he asks us?
Lastly, their SF green card rating is 88. You can't really rate somewhere unless you try it yourself. So tried but won't be coming back.
author: Mark M.

description:
The location is so close to my mom's workplace.
The owner is so nice and friendly.
The price is a little bit high.
I was waiting to buy 8 rolls for an hour today. I know it's full, but yeah.. sushi for 1 hour?
Well.. I still give 4 stars because the food is good.
The dragon roll is fabulous!
author: Candice L.

description:
I was really craving Amami but they were closed. I opted for this place after checking Yelp for the nearest sushi restaurant and of decent quality. I called for to-go and it was a bit difficult to communicate with the employees. However, after 4 attempts, they finally understood my order. Not that it was complicated, but maybe because they couldn't understand me correctly through the phone. After ordering, the male employee told me that it'll be ready in 5-10 minutes. I was surprised at how fast it was claimed to be finished by and I arrived within 5-10 minutes. 

My order consisted of sushi lunch combo C and 2 pcs of uni nigiri. My order was surprisingly ready when I arrived. For both items, it came out around $21 and I was surprised by the cost for the quantity. $21 for 8 pcs of California roll, 5 pcs assorted nigiri, and 2 pcs of uni nigiri. The quality was okay, you definitely get what you paid for. I enjoyed the California roll and the uni nigiri. The uni had that gamey-mess I really liked and it did not taste bad. The ratio of crab meat to avocado in the California roll was like 3:1, but nonetheless, it was passable. The quality of the fishes for the assorted nigiri could be better, but like I have mentioned, you get what you pay for. 

The service was friendly and fast. If Amami is closed and I'm craving for sushi, I would definitely come back.
author: Brenda K.

description:
It was very delicious. We are Japanese really like nigiri sushi. This restaurant shari and neta balance very good. A lot of sushi restaurant serve fake Japanese style sushi. Here is authentic Japanese sushi quality. 
Ingredients are very fresh too.
author: Nishigami T.

description: Kevin is a great owner! Sushi is affordable and good quality. I come here a lot for bento box.
author: Martin N.

description: Sushi zen is my absolute favorite sushi place. The lunch special is to die for, I always get the lunch combo with a shrimp tempera roll and a super dynamite roll. I could eat it everyday. It's a bit pricey but that's why we always go for lunch because of the great deals. Definitely should try this place !
author: Kloe K.

description:
Never been to Sushi Zen before, so we decided to try out their lunch specials today since we were craving sushi. Note: they have regular lunch specials and student lunch specials.

Between the two of us, we ordered the Sashimi Combo G (9 pieces of sashimi, miso soup, and rice - $12.50), Tekka Maki Roll ($4.25), and the Katsu Donburi ( miso soup and rice included - $8.50). The fish was very fresh and the donburi was good. Service was quick and friendly. They offer free wifi too. Lunch was about $32 between the two of us.

Overall, the food, price, and service was good. I don't see why I wouldn't return to Sushi Zen to satisfy my sushi cravings next time.
author: Erica L.

description: Solid food. I'm not expecting too much cause it's one of those places with a lot of fancy rolls, not your traditional Japanese place. I had the chicken donburi and scarfed it down. It was flavorful and the right mix. When in SF, I had to get the 49ers Roll. It was delicious, I enjoy tuna and salmon, and California rolls..:so it was the perfect!
author: Arnold W.

description:
We originally tried to go to Tazaki for sushi but found it was closed for the christmas holiday which really sucked. I'm so happy it was closed or else we would have never tried Sushi Zen! Oh man...I can't wait to go back. 

I ordered the bento box with fish katsu and sashimi. They give you 6 fat pieces of sashimi and even accommodated the fact that I don't like red tuna. I got 2 yellowtail, 2 super white tuna, and 2 salmon. The fish katsu was also amazing. You can tell they used really fresh red snapper and a very light batter to make it super crispy. The fish itself was really light and so tender. 

I'll definitely be back because this place has excellent quality and quantity for the money you spend.
author: Sheena N.

description: For inexpensive San Francisco sushi..this place definitely deserves 4 stars for its upper medium quality, portions, and price.  The BEST thing I feel like they have here is their scallop.  They give you a clean LAAARGE ass piece of hotate and its close to being perfect.  I wouldn't compare this place to elephant sushi or sushi sam but dam..they got some really good basic nigiri.
author: Vince L.

description: Okay so the nasty fan is gone, service is great and I'm happy with the food. Kudos to the owners who made the necessary changes to maintain a clean space and also to keep their customers happy! Will be back again :)
author: Ferhen M.

description: We decided to get sushi for dinner and both found this spot. Parking was fairly simple on the streets. The restaurant is pretty tiny -a hole in the wall type of spot. Upon entering, I hear the waiters speaking in Chinese, which was my first question of authenticity for a Japanese restaurant. Either way, we were seated and served water right away although there was a lack of refill for the water later into the meal. We decided to share the Taraval Roll ($9.95), Sunset Strip Roll ($11.95), and King Kong Roll ($11.95). First of all, I didn't like how there was a good five minute gap between each roll that came out. Next, they drizzled a house special sauce over every single roll, which I was not too fond of either. Lastly, the rolls were not assembled tightly as the rice was falling apart and tasted mushy. The sushi rolls would've been worth the value otherwise, but not the best sushi I have had. Overall, okay spot as I'm hoping it was just an off day for the sushi chefs. Will I be back though? Only if I'm craving sushi that badly.
author: Cindy Z.

description: I hate the day my roommate introduced me to Sushi Zen. This place is fiiiiirre. I can get two rolls for under $20 and the designer rolls are fairly priced. My new favorite sushi place on my side of SF. Sushi Zen is a hidden gem and ily
author: Andrea L.

description:
We came here at around 1 in the afternoon on a Saturday and they weren't busy. We had so many tables to choose from, but by the time we were done (around 3), it was packed. 

The rolls here are pretty good! I will always come back here for more sushi. Their hamachi kama (fish neck) is so yummy! Don't hesitate to try!! It may be expensive and sound a little weird but you must try it!
author: Tina R.

description: At lunch the teriyaki chicken is like four bucks, and that's cheap as hell. Five stars!
author: Bobby S.

description: Great neighborhood sushi place - I've been coming here on and off for quite a few years now. Prices are reasonable and I've never had any food poisoning or anything like that. Service can be a little rough especially when placing phone orders but I've never actually had an incorrect order, so there's that. It's not a super stellar/unique place, but it's consistent and has tasty food.
author: Em F.

description: It satisfied my craving for some decent sushi. I ordered the sake, didn't taste as fresh as I would please, but it was tender and soft! 7/10 for sure. My party and I ordered 3 different specialty rolls Salmon Delight, Winter Wonderland, and the Super Dynamite Roll. The Salmon Delight was great 8/10, Salmon was tender and the flavors were not too over bearing. The Winter Wonderland was super sweet for my own taste buds, good but whole lots of sauce (6/10)! And the Super Dynamite Roll was super favorable but got a little overbearing about half way through (6/10), I was surprised to find that the whole role was fried! Definitely a place to check out that's not too expensive and gots decent sushi!
author: Houyee C.

description: Came here twice because of convenience. Both times service was really bad. The food was only ok. I will never come back again.
author: Yvonne W.

description: After a hard working day I decided to have Sushi for dinner. Made the choice to come here, it was a very good decision, friendly staff, good prices and very good food! Will definitely come back!
author: Jerrand R.

description: WOW! So darn good! Was looking for a place in sunset and happened upon this lovely place! So yummy and such great prices! Highly recommend the Winter Wonderland Roll! Will definitely come back again! :)
author: Taylor G.

description: Ok they got some cheap ass specials for students , which I loved. My broke ass could finally eat . The food was still pretty good though, nothing hella amazing
author: Nathan W.

description: You pay what you get. Price is good for a neighborhood sushi restaurant. Not the fanciest or the most fresh. Service I'll give it a two or three stars. I come here when I want some sushi but don't want to drive far.
author: Nicole P.

description:
Had a wonderful Valentine's dinner at this restaurant. Although I'm normally inclined to buy a lot of sushi, i couldn't pull myself to buying sushi knowing there's another sushi restaurant that has half off Wednesdays, so we opted for the sashimi, chicken teriyaki / tempura bento plate, and the grilled squid.

The best grilled squid i've had in quite a while and would definitely come back just for that. The texture was soft and chewy, but not rubbery. The mayonnaise sauce was a great compliment, but the standard sauce they have it in was more than enough flavor. The portion size for this was quite generous as well.

The sashimi was still frozen, so although this is a sushi place, i don't think i'll have sushi next time either.

Chicken teriyaki was average taste, but was filling. The tempura was nice and hot and had a good consistency. There were two shrimps, a couple of yams, green beans, egg plant, and maybe another item or two that weren't as memorable.

Between a 4 and 5 star is what i would give this, but with the frozen sashimi, it's closer to a 4 star.
author: Ricky J.

description:
Excellent meal!

Came in at 6pm on a Monday night. Got seated right away, friendly service.

Ordered an assortment of nigiri, tuna sashimi, and a couple of special rolls. Everything came out quick and delicious!

Topped off the meal with green tea ice cream - on the house! That totally won me over! 

Will definitely come back! 
Only downside was parking is scarce.
author: Victoria L.

description: My girlfriend and I took out a few sushi rolls for dinner, and we were not impressed. We've had our fair share of sushi places in the city, but thought we'd try something new. Big mistake. The sushi was rolled so poorly, you couldn't even pick it up without it falling apart. Each roll was cut inconsistently and ingredients didn't taste fresh. Some sides of the roll had more rice than others, causing them to fall apart immediately after picking it up.  Other pieces tasted soggy like it had been sitting out. Save yourself the disappointment and go somewhere else.
author: Desmond D.

description:
I've only been here once and I was distracted since I was catching up with a dear friend so my review is based on that one visit. When we walked in, it wasn't that busy then it got busy right when we got seated. They don't have high chairs for kids, they gave us a booster for my 1.5 year old son. My slight problem is that the booster can't be strapped on the seat or there's nothing to strap the toddler in. For an older kid that's fine, but for my son, I thought he was still a bit too young. In the end it worked out but we were more cautious. 
We got the agedashi tofu and 3 rolls that I can't remember. I liked that the rolls are not wrapped with much rice. Price was reasonable. 
Service was okay. Not warm nor engaging.
author: Claire J.

description: Pretty good, if a little bland, sushi.   I guess this is good because you can spice it us to your own taste with the wasabi.  Service was speedy but not very friendly, and when asked a question, they did not respond.   The agedashi tofu was excellent, as was the shrimp tempura.
author: Yang Q.

description: One of the most affordable sushi places I've been to in SF, with good sushi, teriyaki and low prices. The staff are so friendly too.
author: Lea C.

description:
I used to come here after school for some cheap but solid sushi but its been awhile since I've been back and now, it looks like the quality went down but the prices went up.

I came on a Thursday night randomly and the place was empty. A few people came in and out for delivery orders but the ambiance inside is nothing too fancy and was a little unnerving since we were the only ones there!

We ordered some California rolls and a Rainbow roll. I feel like the prices were pretty standard as far as non-fancy sushi places go but my California rolls had a lot of mayonnaise. Still tasted pretty good but after a few pieces it started to feel pretty heavy. Rainbow roll was solid!
author: Jingxi Z.

description:
My go to sushi place! I hate how if you want good sushi it's either too expensive or the wait is almost an hour. At Sushi Zen, that's not the case. I don't have to wait AND I can afford it.

If you love salmon like I do, I recommend the  Sunset Strip and the British Colombia roll. Those are definitely my favorites. (Around $11 each)

Love unagi? The King Kong roll and the dragon roll are pretty good. 

They have decently priced lunch box and dinner specials as well that I have tried and liked.

Overall, I don't think you can go wrong with anything here. I will come back again and again to fix my sushi cravings.
author: Corinna T.

description:
I've come here a few times, and it's usually quiet and empty.  However, nothing to worry about because the sushi rolls here are actually pretty good.  I especially like the Lazy Summer Roll that's wrapped in cucumber with no rice.

Decent place for sushi around the area that I don't mind coming back.
author: Karen L.

description: I am always leery of any small mom and pop operation but this one was really really good. Very fresh sashimi and the rolls were also very good. A lot of time the fish used in rolls is of the poorest quality but not at all in this case. Also very inexpensive compared to other places in the city for similar quality fish. I was very pleased and will definitely return.
author: Shelley R.

description:
Small, homey, and everything you are looking to fulfill your sushi crave is here. 

I can't believe I didn't know about Sushi Zen until last week. I was craving for Americanized sushi rolls and didn't want to travel too far, nor did I want to spend too much money on it, Yelp got me Sushi Zen. I placed a togo order over the phone, the server who picked up the call was very friendly, and my order was ready in 20 mins -- just when I arrived. 

As a first-timer, I picked Yelpers' suggestions -- Winter Wonderland and Sunset Strip. Totally fulfill my sushi roll craves. I decided to go back with my friend on Saturday. This time, we got Wasabi Hama, British Columbia, and Taraval Roll. As the second attempt, these rolls were not as sauce-y as we expected, however, I feel it's good so now we know not every roll is sauce-y.

By peaking the interaction between the sushi chef and customers, I can tell Sushi Zen has a solid customer based and they keep coming back, that's great for a small business like Sushi Zen. 

The parking was easy if you don't mind to walk 2-3 blocks. 

2016026
author: Leslie C.

description: MmmMMMM. Cute little almost hole-in-the-wall type of place. Came in for lunch on a Saturday and our group was promptly seated, but came in a couple hours later the week after and the place was packed! Service here has been great. Both times I've been here, the workers were attentive and very friendly. The prices were moderate for a sushi place. I ordered the chirashi and the sashimi pieces were fresh and not skimpily cut. +1 for the slices of avocado and generous pile of seaweed salad that was included. The miso soup was pretty on par with the usual Japanese restaurants I've been to, so I don't really have anything to say about that. I'd come here again if I'm around the area and don't know where to go for lunch. Pretty enjoyable experiences the couple times I've been here. Shout out to Jimmy for the friendly service!
author: Stephanie C.

description: This is a great family restaurant that offers exquisite Japanese cuisine for a pretty decent price. All the sushi is always fresh, and the staff is extremely friendly. The wait time is around ten minute tops, and the food is excellent. If you are unsure of this place, give it a try! Free Wifi is also included. Average tab per person without drinks is $10.
author: Justin C.

description:
Maybe it was an off night but it wasn't just one thing that was off.

- The beef teriyaki tasted like it was boiled and they just added the teriyaki sauce on top of it. Plus half of the teriyaki was well done and the other half was rare. Rare boiled beef - not for for me.
- Ordered maguro and shiro maguro. Maguro was fine - shiro was stringy.
- Tekka maki came out instead of kappa maki.

Service staff was pleasant. One one wall, the place has lots of picture (of patrons I guess) and on the other drawings (by kids, I assume). 

Doubtful if I'll go back there.
author: Nick K.

description: Most Japanese restaurants close at 2 or 3pm so I like how this place closes at 3:45pm. Cuz if you're in the area and just want sushi the time of day limits the places you can eat at. It was my first time here and I actually enjoyed the rolls more than I thought. I'm a big critic of grilled squid and uni and I have to admit, they were both VERY good. i didn't want to get my hopes up for the uni but it was deliciously fresh! I've even dined at a michelin star restaurant recently, I won't mention it's name, but their uni that day wasn't even this fresh! We ordered the grilled squid, uni (added a quail egg), sunset spring roll, king kong roll. i would definitely dine here again to try more of their menu!
author: Sarina A.

description: Food fastastic taste.!!!  Quick service, food are steaming hot (sukiyaki).  Price very reasonable.  I highly recommend this Japanese Restaurant.
author: Beth S.

description:
I wish they have more dinner bento box options. I think all they had was tempura as the 2nd option? 

I like being able to choose either sashimi, california roll, or even another meat entree for my 2nd choice. I was disappointed by that. 

BUT the guy who greeted me was super sweet and welcoming, he even gave us free ice cream on the house. 

Hmm... They might have better lunch menu, I will try that next time.
author: Debbie D.

description: I hate basing my reviews of service but this place was just terrible. Waitress was impatient and very unwelcoming. Food came out fast but was decent. Will not be returning :)
author: Raman D.

description:
came here first time ever and was greeted right the way - sat at the sushi bar and order the 12 piece chef's choice sashimi with a seaweed salad 
the fish were so fresh! loved the fatty tuna
Kevin the chef-owner is very nice and chatty 
will definitely be back next time I'm in the area
author: Mia C.

description:
4 stars for their lunch specials! 

This place brings me back to high school (go Mustangs!!) where we would travel long and far (lol) and up and down those hills... anything but high school cafeteria food or beanery right?! (just kidding, shout out to those chocolate chip cookies from the beanery!!)

Their lunch bento box and sushi roll specials are awesome! They're pretty big portions for the price. Their rolls can often have more rice portioned out than I would like, but it does the job to get that craving fix. 

This place is a pretty standard neighborhood Chinese-owned Japanese restaurant!
author: Kris C.

description: Awesome lunch menu and tasty creative rolls (Sunset Strip roll!!!)! I always leave with my sushi craving satisfied, and I know I can always count on Sushi Zen for a good meal. Not the best sushi you'll have in SF, but extremely worth it for the price and convenience.
author: Shawna C.

description:
This place is decent if you're just craving for some cheap sushi. 

Customer service was okay. The waitress did not check up on us and was just lack of positive vibe. It was around 5 PM and there was only two tables being served besides ours. That's one of the main thing I pay attention to most when I'm dining in at any restaurant. 

We ordered the Rainbow roll, Assorted Sashimi (10 pc), and Salmon Skin Handroll. 

Rainbow roll: The fish on top did not look fresh, the flavor of the california roll on the other hand was great though. 

Assorted Sashimi: Salmon, Yellow Tail, Tuna, and White Tuna. The color of the fish looks old and taste like it has been sitting out at room temperature. This made me stop eating. 

Salmon Skin Handroll: I believe their salmon skin is not fried, therefore it was mussy and soggy with the excess sauce added. I do love the fact they add in a lot of Tobiko (fish eggs). Their julienne chopping of the vegetable need some work, since it's very thick for a handroll.

You really do get what you pay for here. I don't believe I will be returning to this place.
author: May N.

description:
Amazing for some bomb-ass sushi rolls!

Been at this joint a couple of times and everything was super impressive. This place definitely did me justice when I was craving yummy sushi. All the rolls I've tried have been ON POINT! The following are the ones I've tried: 
-Crazy Sushi (crunchy texture made it AMAZING)
-King Kong
-Lazy summer roll (can I say Fresh?!)

I've also tried the grilled squid with mayo...a must order when I'm there, I always crave it and they make it so good! Overall, this is my Go-To place for some awesome sushi when in the Sunset District. I always find a seat here and no wait. The service is great, so no complaints here!
author: Michelle S.

description: This was actually such good sushi! It was so presentable, and tasted just as good as it looked. And they had extremely good service and were friendly! Definitely recommend
author: Jenna H.

description: The hamachi sashimi was frozen in the middle, and not that cheap. Another mediocre sushi place. It was better the first time we went, not sure what happened this time.
author: Peter O.

description:
Typical sushi restaurant in San Francisco.

The restaurant staff seemed annoyed whenever we waved our hand at them. I sat near the door and when the owner noticed my hand up, he screamed "CAN I HELP YOU?!" Sir, I'm not going to scream across the restaurant lol.. 

Sushi Zen is a small restaurant but it seems like the waiters couldn't handle their customers. They took over 10 minutes to give us our bill.. 

Be aware that this place is located right next to the Metro, so don't be surprised when your seat vibrates as a train passes by.
author: Danae L.

description:
I've been here twice, once for lunch and once for dinner. The lunch was tasty, came out quick, and was very reasonably priced. a California roll, some chicken katsu, a salad, and rice, all delicious. The place was pretty much empty, so everything came quickly.  When I came for dinner, the place was absolutely slammed, and it took quite a bit of time to get our orders in after we were seated.
I had a Rainbow roll and Tuna Nigiri both of which were delicious, my date had a Philadelphia roll which she enjoyed a lot. We also got miso soup which was very standard, but came out about 15 minutes after everything else did. After that it was another extensive wait for the check. 
Overall I really love this place and I'm sure I'll be back, but I had to knock off a point for the service. I can't begrudge them for it because it was a busy Saturday night and things happen, but they probably need more than two servers.
author: Evan P.

description: Great cozy place with super friendly staff who really try to make you feel welcome. Efficient service, awesome miso soup, great sushi..and large menu.
author: Emo S.

description:
Me and one other came here looking for a great late Tuesday sushi lunch. It was fabulous. I enjoyed the dragon roll, the edamame, and the sashimi combo. They use fabulous and high quality ingredients!!! 
I would highly suggest this for a dinner or lunch with anybody. I hope to return here soon.
author: Will D.

description: Stopped for lunch on our summer vacation trip in town.  Love the cute, Japanese decor and the staff is super friendly.  My son had the maguro nigiri sushi and a poke salad-loved the tuna!!  I opted for oshiko roll and oyaki donburi.  Very tasty!  With bits of kamaboko and enoki mushrooms, it was perfect for a blustery day!  The tea is genmai Cha that tastes of toasty rice...very reasonable prices.  A little bit of Japan in Parkside area of SF.
author: Cynthia B.

description: Not super zen service but hey! Their veg Udon is PERFECT!!!!! Will be coming back just for that
author: Lauren-Michelle R.

description:
I came here sometime in 2013 and left unsatisfied, never wanting to come back here again. Couple days ago, I happened to stumbled in here again forgetting about my first experience. After stepping in and realizing which restaurant I was in, I decided to give it another chance. My bf and I ordered a couple of their special rolls and the uni sashimi. Rolls were okay, but the quality and color of the fishes seemed off and didn't taste fresh. There was a piece of fish bone in one of the pieces that I ate which took me by surprise. The uni was light in color and looked bad. I took a small bite and it was foul and gritty, the most disgusting uni I ever tasted. We immediately told our server and with the chef's permission, they took it away and didn't charge us. 

I'm honestly surprised I didn't get food poisoning from here, but I rather not risk it and will avoid this place. Let's just hope I'll remember next time.
author: Renee Y.

description: Fresh, small, intimate, cute, sushi is outstanding. This is our Sunset go to. Service is always slow which I don't understand with so few tables but the freshness of the sushi outweighs that only negative.
author: Monique P.

description: Great lil place! Service is solid and the sushi... the SUSHI is Incredible! This is my new favorite place in SF. Will definitely go back... everything was Oishi!!
author: Nicholas B.

description: Not Japanese owned and not very traditional but the fish is fresh and the rolls tasted good. They have great customer service and the servers are nice. This is somewhere I would go for a quick meal. Came here in the middle of the day when most places in this area is closed to prep for dinner. Food wise, it was not a super impressive experience but to fill me and satisify my sashimi cravings then this place does the job.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Sushi Zen is another typical Chinese-owned Japanese restaurant, so don't expect much in terms of authenticity. 

When we arrived for lunch, we were seated immediately; they were pretty busy with only two other tables empty. We were served hot tea promptly, which is always nice on a gloomy day. We ordered the half shell oyster appetizer, 4 nigiri orders (2 albacore, maguro, and ika) and 2 rolls (White Winter and Sunset Strip). Our orders came separately, but evenly spaced out. 

Nigiri: The maguro was fresh, the albacore was very soft, and the ika was good too. The rice was a little too warm for my liking though. 
Rolls: Both rolls weren't very tightly rolled and didn't seem to have enough rice to even hold everything together. The Sunset Strip roll was decent, but they went a little overboard with the green onion garnish. The White Winter roll was better made, but still just an average roll. The rolls seemed a bit "skinny" too, probably not enough rice. They're also a bit heavy-handed with sauces too. 
Oysters: Presentation was blah, and there was too much of the shredded radish and white onion, making it a bit hard to eat in one go. But the oysters were nice and creamy, and the sauce was good (wish they gave a bit more). 

Service was good. They don't give you a teapot, but they refill often enough that you never have an empty cup. Our bill came out to $46 before tip. 

Overall, average sushi and no big complaints.
author: Doris K.

description: First timer with my girl and man it was good. Had the sushi zen special "19th Ave" roll and the "ocean beach" roll and it was so good my girl barely used soy sauce. Lol will be coming here more often. Friendly workers, fast service. This place is awesome. Just got a surprised ice cream. Mmmm good date night. 5 STARS!!
author: Vincent D.

description: Really nice sushi. Came here for dinner and ordered some Miso Soup, Gyoza, the california roll and avocado maki. Excellent meal!
author: Emilia K.

description:
This place is fairly average to me overall. I don't really see myself coming here all the time, but I have been here several times in the past with not too many memorable experiences.

I did come here yesterday with my grandma because she wanted Japanese food, so because this is the closest restaurant to us, we decided to take a little walk over. They greeted as we walked in and gave us ice water and tea. We got their lunch special bento boxes; I got the salmon teriyaki with sashimi (substituted from the tempura for same price!) and four small pieces of California rolls ($7.95). My grandma got the chicken teriyaki with tempura and Cali roll as well ($7.50). Both came with a small slab of wasabi, miso soup, rice, and a little side of salad. I was pretty full afterwards. A part of me was tempted to try their chirashi bowl for $12.95, which I thought was a fairly good price. I think next time I will go for that, and also one of their specialty rolls.

The service was good. We got our food pretty fast despite how many people were there and the lady kept refilling our waters and tea. 

The restaurant is a little squished with not too much room, and the lighting isn't all that great. There are always flies at the door when you walk in which is pretty gross. They do have pictures of people eating and showing off their experience in the restaurant which is kinda cool, since you don't see that very often.
author: Kathleen S.

description: My go to for cheap Japanese food. This place is golden their speciality rolls are fulfilling and tempura udon -amazing. Quantity over quality so for all you cheap MF's ready for a good meal this is the place to go...it dominates any sushi joint in the sunset district. They also offer student deals -yafeel'me?! I recommend anything on the menu.
author: Brian B.

description: Came here with my bf. This location is a couple blocks down from Sushi Raw. Between the two locations, I prefer this more. We ordered white wonderland and Super white tuna roll. I wanted the white tuna roll since it was supposed to be topped with wasabi tobiko (not sure how to spell it, but its the tiny fish egg, things..). I enjoyed the white wonderland since it was super saucy and I love my sushi saucy. But as for the Super white tuna roll, I was kind of disappointed. I didn't quite taste wasabi in the tiny balls. We also got the sunset roll which was pretty good as well. I enjoyed the atmosphere more so than Sushi Raw. The parking was okay, not too hard to find. I also thought that the tea could have been hotter, I don't like lukewarm tea. The place is pretty small and very intimate. Good service.
author: Amy Y.

description: Came here for dinner just from yelping around looking for sushi to eat. This place was alright. I wouldn't say I loved it, but I wouldn't say I hated it. I got the udon noodles and they were good. If I needed to satisfy a craving, I'd come back here. It was decent, prices were okay, service was good. Nothing bad to say about this place, nothing amazing to say either.
author: Julie L.

description: Food was good, all I got were the rolls. Service was decent here just now that if you are coming with a large party, her here a bit earlier as this place is a bit small.
author: Mila C.

description: Quality is above average. However the quantity of fish in the sushi they offer is usually larger than nornal
author: Brock F.

description: i like this place! great prices, nice atmosphere & good food, friendly service as well. we celebrated my friends' birthday and they sang happy birthday with us and served us ice cream which was complimentary!
author: Carla E.

description:
Went there on a whim one Wednesday night a few weeks back and it was PACKED.  My friend and I ended up at the Sushi bar/counter and it was perfect for two small women.  They have an AWESOME selection of delectable rolls and a good selection of the higher-end cold Sake as well.  I loved EVERYTHING but my very favorite thing in the world:  Hamachi.  It was fresh, for sure, but super chilled as if it had come out of a freezer and was recently unfrozen.  So, that's the ONLY reason for the 4 and not 5 stars.  Excellent food and drink, Great prices, Great family who own it, Great customers who are cool and happy.

Why did it take me 3 weeks to write about it?  Because I'm craving it right now for LUNCH and am heading over in 3...2...1...
author: Dana J.

description: Best sushi place EVER!!!!! amazing prices for delicious high quality raw fish. It's a comfortable restaurant with pictures of customers on the wall which makes it feel personal and welcoming:) I recommend to anyone who's visiting or looking for sushi in the area. I commute with my boyfriend 30 minutes to go there because we love it so much! We spend our anniversary there every month:) can't wait to go back!
author: June A.

description:
This is not a fancy place ... Good clean sushi, good service & generous raw fish for an affordable price. We ordered a variety of nigiri, tempura roll, spicy tuna roll, Hawaiian roll & CA roll & miso soup and we enjoyed it all. Really liked the spicy tuna. 
Thanks for keeping your restroom clean!
author: Vicki M.

description:
Recently popped in here with friends for a bite and lots of catching up.

It was a toss up between this place, or nearby Okazuya, which I haven't been to in several years.  We rolled the dice and chose this joynt, since none of us had tried it before.  Although Okazuya is certainly decent, it's always been a zoo when I've been there and I was hoping for something a bit more laid back and quieter, which Sushi Zen definitely is.

Of everything ordered, the standout for me was the Winter Wonderland roll and the Salmon Nigiri.  Everything else was just plain boring.

The highlight of my evening, was discovering midway through the meal that I was sitting at Brady's table.  That made it all worthwhile for me.  Why, is none of your business.  

Let's just say if I ever go back, I will only sit at that table and reminisce about good times.

In the meantime, I will continue my search for excellent sushi in SF.
author: Anthony D.

description:
My friend and I was looking for a sushi spot to eat since we were both craving Japanese.  We decided on this spot since an acquaintance wanted to meet here for dinner.  

I didn't have high expectations for this spot since my friend said this place was not good to her.

I ordered the Katsu sashimi platter and I did enjoy the Katsu platter.  But it's pretty hard to mess up katsu.  The sashimi on the other hand was a different story.  The fish was not fresh at all and tasted old.  The fish had liquid draining onto the plate which probably meant it was frozen.

They also messed up the bill and charged me 18 dollars more.  They at least fixed that.

This is must not go again for me.
author: A L.

description:
I was not impressed with the VERY bland rolls.
Gyoza was very greasy and borderline inedible.  appetizer did not come first and rolls came out separately...The server was on the rude side, and a bit scattered. Completely ignored my lunch date while ordering and walked away mid order several times. Then we had to approach the back register for our check while others had theirs delivered to them.
author: Laufey A.

description:
Went here with friends and ordered four rolls. Decent quality for the price ($28) and the fish was relatively fresh. I would definitely recommend the rock n roll, the best out of the four. The eel in it was great.

Overall, good place to get decent sushi at a reasonable price.
author: Ryan W.

description: Always a good experience here! Love the service as well as the affordability. Staff is always great and it is a great sushi place for any occasion.
author: Barry H.

description:
Our family used to like this place, but it seems to have some consistency problems and in the last couple of years we've had some bad experiences.  Perhaps it's hit or miss.

Recently we noticed their food didn't seem fresh.  My salad seemed like it was a few days old and on another occasion, my wife got food poisoning.  My wife is not confident that their staff consistently practice good hygiene.  It's sad, as we have fond memories of enjoyable meals there, and it can be a fun place, but we feel that they cut the corners too much to be a safe option for sushi and sashimi.
author: Bob S.

description: Boy does this place bring back memories. I went to Lincoln High School and would walk down to Taraval for lunch. I would always order the chicken katsu, and if i was reaallllyy hungry i'd order the sushi too. I love that this place has student specials! I'm not sure how much it was when I was going to Lincoln, but  now its 4 bucks for chicken katsu. I still come every so often and ask for the student special! Definitely worth it for 4 bucks! I haven't seen the sushi lately, but thats only because I don't come during Lincoln's lunch time. I will always come back for the chicken katsu!!!
author: Kelly S.

description: Kinda used to a bit more fish in my chirashi, but the quality of the fish was pretty good.  Really convenient hole in the wall, but I wonder why the customer count was a bit low for 7pm
author: Ralph I.

description: Pretty good deal for lunch nearby SFSU. Their bento is unbeatable in San Francisco. The chicken Katsu is juicy, and coming with sashimi(not just salmon). So far their waiters are nice and friendly. I would come back again.
author: Kent W.

description: If you don't mind the instant miso soup and overly thick and cold sashimi slices then this is an ok place to visit. Service was swift, friendly and polite although the chatter between waiter and chef as the waiter chows down his lunch in front of customers was off-putting.
author: Roger F.

description:
This is a place I have been eating at for almost 3 years. Lately I've been frequenting every week. British Columbia is my all time favorite roll anywhere, and I'm so glad they serve it here.

The service can be a tad slow, but that is because it's a small restaurant and lots of people come in large groups. It's worth the wait, because the staff is polite and the food is great. 

It has a cozy ambiance, and it will always be a favorite spot of mine on Taraval :)

P.S. People that ordered non-sushi items and gimmicky rolls need to shut up about it. You should always order what the restaurant specializes in if you want a good experience. Get a simplistic roll, enjoy the amount of fish they put in there and how they lightly season their sushi rice. If you want explosions and fireworks with your fish, this place isn't right for you!
author: Selin A.

description: "Out-of-towners", i myself work at a sushi joint out of state, great quality fish here!, quick, quaint, and surprisingly great prices. Skip the big bay restaurants and find a smaller shop to support like Sushi Zen, you won't be disappointed!
author: Ashlen T.

description:
If you...

1. Are non-Asian
2. Think sushi is defined by tempura, rolls, and bento boxes
3. Are on a budget but still want "sushi"
4. Are unable to differentiate between fresh raw fish and unfresh raw fish
5. Are trying to do sake bombs, also on a budget
6. Enjoy Panda Express and/or Mission Chinese Food

This is the place for you.
author: Olivia V.

description:
First and last time we come here...

We ordered 2 rolls and an order of sashimi, it ended to be $45. I'm not here to complain about the price... I will and have paid that for good sushi. 

But first the sashimi was not good. It should of been a red flag when the albacore had a pretty fishy taste to it and the tuna had some off coloring 

Second, the 49er roll was eehh. It was a disappointment. There was nothing good to say about it 

Lastly and more horrifying was the 19th avenue roll (as I'm writing this... I'm hoping I don't get sick) it had some sketchy house sauce and a terrible taste. There was cream cheese in the roll and to us it tasted like it was expired. The moment we had one piece we put our chopsticks down... We literally couldnt have gotten out check any faster, we ran out 

I don't recommend this place. We thought the high rating would mean good sushi, but we were wrong for following it.
author: Maribel E.

description: I started going to Sushi Zen in 2014 and I now go once every other week. The sushi chef is as friendly as it gets, the sushi is good quality, and it's a cozy environment where you normally don't have to wait to get seated.
author: Eduardo P.

description:
A pleasant find in the Sunset/Parkside.

I live in the area, but I never really noticed Sushi Zen until my friend sent me a snapchat one day. It's a small place that seems a bit hidden away between the two neighboring buildings. 

I got a table for three during dinner time. I often check Yelp reviews for food recommendations; sadly, the most popular suggestion was the LUNCH special. However, we did try the super dynamite roll as well as the winter wonderland roll. As far as specialty rolls go, both are priced very well for what they give you. I believe they were in the $7-9 range. From past dining experiences around the city, they could have easily charged $10+ for the rolls. Both rolls tasted fresh and were accompanied with delicious sauces drizzled on top. I personally liked the super dynamite roll a little more because it was spicy. 

Sushi Zen offers good quality at good pricing and I would love to try the lunch special one day. The restaurant has given me a brighter outlook on Sunset district Japanese food, masking years of eeehhh or mehhh from tastings around the area.
author: Jonathan C.

description:
I like coming to this sushi spot because it's close to home and inexpensive.

The place is pretty small and cozy. There's probably about ten tables that can hold parties of four, and the sushi bar seating up to six people. There's also free wifi, which is a plus.

I usually get the 10 piece sashimi, agedashi tofu, and amaebi sushi. The sashimi always tastes pretty fresh. My favorites are the yellowtail and the escolar. The amaebi is only $5.50 here and tastes pretty good! They fry the head really well here.

They also have really good priced lunch bento boxes here. I've had the chicken katsu, which is really good here. I'm not a big fan of their rolls here, mainly because they tend to put too much sauce on them.

The staff is always friendly and attentive. I always feel welcomed here.
author: Derek T.

description:
I've come here a few times for lunch.

I usually get the Alaskan roll. Fish is pretty fresh, classic sushi flavors.
Also got the salmon bento lunch combo. Pretty filing stuff. Tempura was nice and crispy, salmon was cooked really well, and the California roll was standard.
author: Pamela N.

description: Salmon skin roll was a hit! But others are just ok. Nice for a local sushi bar. Not the best.
author: Blue B.

description:
I came here for dinner, order some rolls and sashimi. We had the butterfish, which tasted extremely off. It was rubbery and fishy tasting, obviously not fresh. I asked the waitress to take the dish away as it was not edible. The owner comes out and tries to explain that the fish is fresh and that I don't like it because I'm not use to the taste. Seriously? I've had sashimi all my life and plenty of fresh butterfish. I've never had butterfish taste so off that I had to spit out. 

As an owner, it's rude to make it seem as if your customers don't know what they're talking about just cause your food isn't fresh. 

The one star are for the waitresses that are very friendly and attentive. I wouldn't come here ever again.
author: Mazie H.

description:
*Beware* -- their lunch special prices are different than what is advertised outside their door. It costs more to dine in than takeout. 

(They state this on a tiny piece of paper on their crowded wall of customer postings.)

It woulda been nice if our server kindly told us of the special and its Price differences while he was taking our order. Because we did ask about it.

The food was alright, this is more about their customer service. Inform your customers! Don't bait-advertise lower prices outside your door just to lure in traffic. And then present a higher priced bill at the end.

Thats not only illegal, but a bad business practice. Granted it was a minor increase and we didnt wanna go argue for an hour jus for a few bucks. But still, this changes my opinion of this place.

(I've eaten here on several occasions, mostly for dinner)

Subsequently, some Lincoln high school kids came in, ordered the lunch special as TAKEOUT and then proceeded to dine INSIDE the restaurant. The Hell?!?!

Waitstaff did not Give a F. Let em eat there.

Next time i will do that. Just to prove a pt to their crappy signage / business practices.
author: Sammy L.

description:
This place is very fun inside, pictures on the wall of all their guests. It is probably a lot of fun for dinner, you can tell there are a lot of regulars. Everyone is very friendly and they didn't give me a hard time when I asked for a lot of lemon like I always do.
The fish, you can tell the taste of the fish is so fresh and wonderful! The rolls they have a good selection of different rolls, this place is great and I will defiantly be coming again!
author: Karli S.

description: We popped in on a Friday afternoon for a small bite. The restaurant is kind of a hole in the wall, but the staff were very polite and inviting. We ordered the chicken katsu bento lunch special and pot stickers. It included california rolls and sashimi but we opted for all california rolls. The food came out very fast and was really cheap! It was very tasty and fresh. I'm glad we gave it a shot!
author: Joanna B.

description: Great and home-like feel kind of atmosphere. Food was good especially the sashimi but what they lack was service especially forgetting some of my dishes.
author: Peter Y.

description: Went in for a quick sushi dinner.  I've never been here before and it was fantastic food.  The salmon was so tender and flavorful.  We had the British Columbia, rainbow, and one other (don't remember the name but it was tuna and salmon outside with Unagi, mango and tuna inside).  Absolutely delicious.  Definitely going to come here again - and easy access from SFSU.
author: Brad M.

description: Fare priced, fresh fish and good service. Everything went smoothly and I enjoyed the food. Definitely a place to check out!
author: Charles O.

description:
I am sitting here writing this review, I ordered my food at 6:00 pm and my order is taking extremely long today. It is now 6:34pm, earlier a guy was mad about his order not being on time. I cannot blame him but service needs to be quicker. The waitress only cares about getting your money and making sure you paid your meal but does not acknowledge you after you pay. 

Well typical Place run by Chinese folks.
author: Yuri Y.

description:
Quaint little neighborhood sushi joint, would be an easy phrase to describe it.

Definitely a neighborhood institution, with awesome prices and deals offered for students (not my scene anymore but definitely appreciated).

The chirashi bowl and the nigiri sushi plate was quite fresh and good quality, with thick cuts of fish - definitely good value for the price. A little heavy on the wasabi and kabayaki sauce, though.

Not bad if you're in the area and want a quick, cheap bite.
author: Claire S.

description:
Food was good. Only thing is the waitress
with long ponytail got her hair on one of customer
Sushi.
author: William W.

description: I have been here twice and have not been disappointed yet. It is reasonably priced and always comes out quickly. First time ordering a plate of sashimi and it was fresh and delicious. Wish they had a few more beers to choose from :). Rolls were great too.
author: Carlee K.

description: This was the BEST sushi ever! It was delicate and flavor blasting! It is a amazing family dinner spot and the sunset strip was exceptional! Come here now!
author: Scott S.

description: All of the sushi is really good.  Ingredients are very fresh and well cooked.  Probably one of the best places to go for raw fish but there fresh sushi is also very good.  Chicken udon is very good also.  Soup is also good.
author: Andrew S.

description:
Omg I'm feeling really bad for making this wrong decision to eat here. This place is not the place you want to eat for authentic Japanese cuisine. 

The sushi:

Overall taste okay but not impressive at all. It tastes like all kind of cheap Chinese Sushi, not authentic or fresh at all. 

The atmosphere:

I don't like the environment over there. Not feeling clean, I could see bugs on the wall.

The price:

The sushi there are much overpriced, doesn't match its quality or anything. 

I don't like here, the sushi tastes bad to me, and I'm not coming back!
author: Evelyn W.

description: This is a little sushi shop tucked away next to a Chinese medicine shop. There are so many mediocre sushi joints just on Taraval, I walked in with very low expectations. The sashimi tasted fresh and was served at the right temperature. The spicy tuna hand roll was perfectly rolled with spicy tuna evenly distributed all down to the bottom tip of the cone. I hate it when they put one huge chunk on top and all you have is rice at the bottom. Overall, great value for the quality of the sushi. I think sometimes when they're busy, the rolls are a bit sloppy, so try to come early for dinner.
author: Janny S.

description:
Dinner time food was good. Sound was loud both inside the restaurant and outside (due to muni trains).

Regular prices of sushi so relatively expensive. It is near the other sushi place up the block sushi raw. I have now been to both. I can not tell a major difference in quality.
author: Nathan A.

description: I had an amazing Dragon roll, cuz it's so good I ordered another King Kong roll!!! So tasty. I highly recommend this place for sushi. The Udon soup taste so authentic. If you compare the soup from the one in stonestown mall. The agadashi tofu is so good too!!! One of the best Japanese places I've ever been to.
author: Range B.

description: Good service, but food quality was not that great. I ordered a British Columbia roll that had salmon sashimi on it, and it didn't look or taste very fresh. Overall the whole sushi roll tasted pretty mediocre as well. My friend got beef udon and he said the beef was not good either. Would probably not come back again.
author: J W.

description:
This place was great!!  Spot-on customer service, friendly and comfortable atmosphere, super quick, and very tasty.  I got the beef teriyaki and a roll.  The first roll I really didn't care for (nothing about the quality of the fish; I just didn't personally care for the flavors of the sauce with the fish) so I got a california roll (which was awesome-- fresh crab!).  I insisted on paying for the first because it was a taste preference, not a quality, yet they insisted on taking it off my bill.

When I got in the restaurant, I realized I left my phone laying out in the car.  They offered to hold my table when I went out to get it.  Even with this and the second roll, I was in and out of there in at least 50 minutes!  

5 Stars for amazing customer service and delicious food!
author: Chelsea P.

description: Fish was fresh but the execution was poor. The high rating was slightly deceiving based on the flavors. We had the beef soba which was slightly over cooked and flavorless, the spider roll and crazy roll which were messy. Both rolls had a brown sweet sauce that overpowered the rest of the roll. Overall, not a terrible experience but we will not be repeat customers.
author: Christine A.

description:
They sure have a nondescript place as it's easy to miss on Taraval St.  It's squeezed in between other establishments, and it isn't very noticeable.  

However, they do offer a very reasonable lunch menu with a good amount of choices including the typical bento box combination meals.  Plus the teriyaki chicken is how it should be cooked:  Grilled.  I'm put off by other Japanese restaurants that offer teriyaki chicken which tastes more like boiled then fried (with skin) then finally doused with a sauce not resembling teriyaki sauce.

Service is efficient and courteous.  The waitress always made sure that patrons' tea and water glasses were refilled.
author: Luisa T.
